overview: Fifty years after the Cultural Revolution in China, two elderly Chinese women recited the propaganda songs they learned at the educational camps. Walking along a Chinese village river, the women sing these songs while the film shows shots of the river. For most of the film, we don’t see either of the women’s faces as they reflect and narrate their past. The robbing of their youth in these camps causes them to dwell on their feeling of nostalgia and regret.
title: Dark River
